website_summaries.verdict: Controls oil temperature, preventing splattering during high volume frying situations.
pros: We love that it can hold a lot of oil, however we love it even more as it doesn't have to use much oil to create that perfect crispy texture
A favorite of many customers for its ability to maintain oil heat for long periods of time
cons: Can fulfill your frying needs from the get go, but may not hold up after a year of regular use

customer_reviews.title: This Waring Commerical deep fryer is fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely satisfied with the superb performance of this deep fryer. I was especially impressed that it maintained the temperature of the oil while I fried several batches of chicken. Since the oil neither popped nor splattered, I didn't worry about burning myself while I either added food or raised and lowered the basket. (I used the 2-lb. steel wire basket that's available as an accessory.) This deep fryer turned out non-greasy, crisp fried chicken and french fries. I'm a home cook. I bought this deep fryer to use when I entertain guests. It's the best small appliance that I've ever purchased, and I strongly recommend it to anyone who wants to prepare perfect fried foods.
customer_reviews.author: seebyrdie

customer_reviews.title: The best compact fryer on AMAZON!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a new fryer I bought 2 months ago with this Waring. Half the oil and super quick heat up time. I love this fryer and the space savings is wonderful. 5 stars from a great name brand. Buying another one for the space saved and doubling my cooking weight. Thanks guys!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado RV Parks LLC

customer_reviews.title: Not hot enough
customer_reviews.text: Does not reach desired temperatures. Had it set at Max 375 and never got above 275 when I tested with deep-fry thermometer. Also splatters all over the place as there is no lid. Comes with two small baskets and no choice to select the single basket. Single basked costs over $100 which is outrageous. Not a true Commercial fryer. Very flimsy built fake.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shakour

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Deep Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fryer. The plug on mine was US 208V as expected, not many homes have these. I'm overseas and changed out the plug to the normal European 240V and this thing heats up like a champ. Large heating unit in the oil assures good temperature recovery when you place frozen foods in. 2700W heating element gets up and goes. Looks like the build quality on these is meant to last a lifetime, good stuff here.
customer_reviews.author: awGuru

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Heats up fast and recovers quickly when cold food is dropped in. Able to make restaurant quality deep fried food at last. Don't waste your money on 110 volt home units. They won't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Toolmaker

customer_reviews.title: The cheaper model actually has a nice cover and an extra frying basket
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly overpriced fryer. No handle to pour out the oil or fat, no cover on top. The cheaper model actually has a nice cover and an extra frying basket. I works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... waiting for - needs more oil than the manufacturers recommend - but other than that - perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the one I've been waiting for - needs more oil than the manufacturers recommend - but other than that - perfect!
customer_reviews.author: robear

customer_reviews.title: Like was already said
customer_reviews.text: Like was already said, no lid...The 8 1/2 pound fryer has dual baskets, they don't have a lid for that. $50+ for the single basket lid, no help and way overpriced. Thanks Waring... Good fryer at least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Only wish they had a cover to use in between usage
customer_reviews.author: michael o, brien

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it but wish I had gotten the 220V version
customer_reviews.author: Carey Probst

customer_reviews.title: Great deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: Great deep fryer. Held the temp like a champ as I filled it with batch after batch of frozen wings
customer_reviews.author: J. Peters

customer_reviews.title: RIP it was a good year and a half
customer_reviews.text: worked well for over a year at our busy restaurant. Died after 18 months. You get what you pay for .
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cawley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We love the fact this is so easy to clean,no messy lid or filters. Good size basket and compact for use on the kitchen bench.
customer_reviews.author: mark thompson

customer_reviews.title: Dang Good Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Dang good fryer, what's not to like other than the smaller baskets
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The fryer has performed well for one of it's cost ...
customer_reviews.text: The fryer has performed well for one of it's cost. The handles could be attached differently to make them easier to remove for storage.
customer_reviews.author: ron taylor

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: looks like any household brand that cost $50 cheap-- bought a real commercial at local rest supply
customer_reviews.author: diane innocenti

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Same ol same ol. Been getting this Fryer for years
customer_reviews.author: Lucys P.

customer_reviews.title: Best fryer ive ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Best 120vac fryer ive used! It comes to temp (250F) quickly, and recovers temp VERY quickly between batches. I fried 14 saddles of frog legs in each batch! After 60 frog legs, fried 1/2 lb of shrimp in each basket. 1 lb of shrimp in 1 batch. Total frying time, 50 minutes. Easy to clean, easy to operate. So easy a coonass, i mean caveman could do it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer
customer_reviews.text: works excellent highly recommend, fry;s food at a great time, heating levels are excellent...Go for it.. its not to heavy cleaning process is easy....
customer_reviews.author: terry carter

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my Superbowl wings (300) and it worked like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my Superbowl wings (300) and it worked like a champ! Great fryer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Gan

customer_reviews.title: NOT Commercial and DOES NOT GET TO 375.
customer_reviews.text: Fryer does not hit 375 even after an hour. Fryer max for us was 340 after 30 min of heating. After adding 2 baskets of fresh thin cut potatoes for french fries. The fryer dropped from 340 to 280. 2 baskets of thin cut potatoes took 15-20 mins. Frys were soggy due to low oil temp. Fresh chicken joints for buffalo wings turned out much better but still temp is not high enough. Construction seems solid but again is not for restaurant use. Close to 1 star but it did ok on chicken. Returning product.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I don't like that deep fries it is very week no power at all very bab
customer_reviews.author: Diem Bui

customer_reviews.title: Read the fine Print on this unit.
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this today. April 24, 2015 This is advertised as an 8.5 lb unit. That must be the weight full, but it can only cook up to 3 lbs of food at a time. Yet its called an 8.5. very deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Curtsinthezone

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated twice
customer_reviews.text: The supplier delivered not one but two fryers with a European plug. Amazon service rep stated the supplier serves the European market as well and after receiving the second product with the same plug Amazon gave me the name of another retailer where I purchased the product without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer
customer_reviews.text: I use this often and love it! It works great and has so many uses I could go on and on, The only draw back is that the large basket is not included and costs over 100 dollars. You can however still cook larger items without it. It is well worth the price, and I would give it a five star rating if all three baskets were included as shown in some pictures. Note; I do realize the fine print does say it was not included but again for the price it should be!
customer_reviews.author: spuds366

customer_reviews.title: Advertising equals results.
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, it works great. Holds more oil than its predecessor, and DOES use a lot less oil, which means that the food is not greasy.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: A Good Deal on an Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I run a small sandwich shop, and we wanted the capability to offer a few fried items without the hassle and expense of a large commercial fryer. We now have 2 of the Waring countertop fryers and they are workhorses! They do everything we need and turn out a good product. They're easy to clean and the oil is simple to change. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Does a great job of keeping the temperature regulated and makes it very easy to fry. Food tastes much better out of it also. Only drawback is that it does not have a lid.
customer_reviews.author: Harris

customer_reviews.title: pefect
customer_reviews.text: perfect home fyer... most home fryers are too small. this is small, but bigger than most... i can cook about 24 chicken wings at a time.... which works for us on football days.
customer_reviews.author: kathi chokenea-baxla

customer_reviews.title: Cooks to perfection
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I fried was Funnel cakes, they were wonderful and very easy! The oil was perfect temperature! I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bad Wilke

customer_reviews.title: Pre-game super star
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for weekend warriors, commercial grade at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Myrick

customer_reviews.title: ... made but doesn't get up to temperature and hold like I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Well made but doesn't get up to temperature and hold like I was expecting. It comes with 2 thin baskets instead of 1 big one, and doesn't come with a lid (had to buy that for an extra $50.00). Fifty dollars for a lid? I could by 2 Fry-Daddy's for that!
customer_reviews.author: Jackflash20

customer_reviews.title: DEEP FRYER WAS WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: It worked wonderful. Did egg rolls in a lot less time than the frying pan. Everyone loved it. Made much less work
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, this is my first deep fryer for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, this is my first deep fryer for a small family. Next time I would get the next size up "Waring WDF1000" which comes with a lid and a large basket.
customer_reviews.author: profheesh

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. No screws to remove so it is easy to disassemble for cleaning. Very well made and I highly recommend this product. It comes with 2 baskets but I would recommend also buying the larger basket for those larger items.
customer_reviews.author: Wlilliam D.

customer_reviews.title: Run Away
customer_reviews.text: NIce. broke and completely stopped working 2 weeks after the return period ended. will not purchase anything Waring ever again
customer_reviews.author: Brock Kellstrom

product_meta.title: Waring Commercial WDF75RC 120-volt Countertop Compact Electric Deep Fryer, 8.5-Pound
product_meta.description: Style Name:120-voltThis countertop compact electric deep fryer features hinged heating element and removable stainless steel tank for easy cleaning. This 8.5-pound capacity fryer includes 2, 1.5-pound steel wire baskets that have a 3-pound food capacity. Additional baskets available (sold separately) : WDF05 - Small 1.5 pound steel wire basket and LFB10 - Large 3 pound steel wire basket. It also features 30-minute timer and variable temperature control up to 390-degree Fahrenheit. It has 208 volt AC, 15 ampere, 1800 watts power rating. Approved by UL, NSF certification. Comes with limited one year warranty. Measures 11-inch height by 16-1/2-inch width by 12-1/4-inch depth.
feature_bullets: Countertop compact electric deep fryer features hinged heating element and removable stainless steel tank for easy cleaning
This 8.5-pound capacity fryer includes 2, 1.5-pound steel wire baskets that have a 3-pound food capacity
Features 30-minute timer and variable temperature control up to 390-degree Fahrenheit
Additional baskets sold separately are WDF05 - Small 1.5 pound steel wire basket and LFB10 - Large 3 pound steel wire basket
Included 240 volt AC, 13 ampere, 2700 watts power rating; Measures 11-inch height by 16-1/2-inch width by 12-1/4-inch depth
